page.title: 08HOUSING - GREETLAND
page.content: There are more houses in the north- ern part of Greetland than in the southern. The main residential area is between Rochdale Road and Briscoe Lane, which were built in the late 19th century. The more recently built houses were built between 1960 and 1980 which are High Meadows, Trenance Gardens and Daleside. The houses around Sunnybank Road were built just before the war. Out of the 623 houses we charted 42.3% were terrace houses; 41.7% are semi detached. Out of the houses we charted terrace housing was the most common closely followed by semi-detached houses. There were no flats or tower blocks.
